segment.source: Access8Math Introduction
segment.target: Access8Math Introduction

segment.source: Access8Math is an NVDA add-on that enhances the user experience when reading and writing mathematical content.
segment.target: Access8Math is an NVDA add-on that enhances the user experience when reading and writing mathematical content.

segment.source: Access8Math offers text-to-speech/Braille functionality for MathML content. MathML is the standard language for describing math structure and content on the web, which enables visually readable math content through a web browser.
segment.target: Access8Math offers text-to-speech/Braille functionality for MathML content. MathML is the standard language for describing math structure and content on the web, which enables visually readable math content through a web browser.

segment.source: Access8Math can also assist in writing and converting LaTeX to MathML. LaTex is a typesetting system which is easy to write and learn. It’s commonly used for representing math formulas.
segment.target: Access8Math can also assist in writing and converting LaTeX to MathML. LaTex is a typesetting system which is easy to write and learn. It’s commonly used for representing math formulas.

segment.source: With Access8Math's reading, writing, and conversion features, visually impaired users can read and write math content with ease. Based on MathML and LaTeX, two common math markups, Access8Math significantly reduces the difficulty of two-way communication between visually impaired and sighted users.
segment.target: With Access8Math's reading, writing, and conversion features, visually impaired users can read and write math content with ease. Based on MathML and LaTeX, two common math markups, Access8Math significantly reduces the difficulty of two-way communication between visually impaired and sighted users.

segment.source: Access8Math Description
segment.target: Access8Math Description

segment.source: The Access8Math add-on provides comprehensive math content reading and writing capabilities.
segment.target: The Access8Math add-on provides comprehensive math content reading and writing capabilities.

segment.source: Access8Math offers customizable speech and braille output, and an Interactive Mode to access and understand math content. In Interactive Mode, users can read math content in smaller segments, as well as choosing the size of the segments through keyboard shortcuts. In this way, they can understand the structure and hierarchical relationships of long math content more easily.
segment.target: Access8Math offers customizable speech and braille output, and an Interactive Mode to access and understand math content. In Interactive Mode, users can read math content in smaller segments, as well as choosing the size of the segments through keyboard shortcuts. In this way, they can understand the structure and hierarchical relationships of long math content more easily.

segment.source: Access8Math also provides a command menu to make writing LaTeX easier. Instead of memorizing complex LaTeX syntaxes, users can navigate through the command menu to input math markups..
segment.target: Access8Math also provides a command menu to make writing LaTeX easier. Instead of memorizing complex LaTeX syntaxes, users can navigate through the command menu to input math markups..

segment.source: In addition, users can preview their inputs while editing, which helps users to find and fix syntax errors as soon as possible.
segment.target: In addition, users can preview their inputs while editing, which helps users to find and fix syntax errors as soon as possible.

segment.source: Finally, Access8Math converts text and math content written in LaTeX into visually readable HTML files. Since both text and math content can be displayed together visually, it makes math discussion between visually impaired and sighted people more fluid.
segment.target: Finally, Access8Math converts text and math content written in LaTeX into visually readable HTML files. Since both text and math content can be displayed together visually, it makes math discussion between visually impaired and sighted people more fluid.

segment.source: Access8Math User Guide
segment.target: Access8Math User Guide

segment.source: Reading Features
segment.target: Reading Features

segment.source: Language Setting
segment.target: Language Setting

segment.source: Select the language in which the math content in Access8Math will be converted in Settings > Reading. If your language is not supported by the system, see the "Adding a new language" paragraph in the "Localization" section of this document.
segment.target: Select the language in which the math content in Access8Math will be converted in Settings > Reading. If your language is not supported by the system, see the "Adding a new language" paragraph in the "Localization" section of this document.

segment.source: Reading Experience Settings
segment.target: Reading Experience Settings

segment.source: Mathematical Structure Analysis
segment.target: Mathematical Structure Analysis

segment.source: These rules are designed to enhance the reading experience of commonly used mathematical structures. The system analyzes the content according to the MathML structure and mathematical rules, so that the speech outputs and Braille outputs are more consistent with the mathematical meaning. For example, "x^2" will be read as "square of x" instead of "x super 2".
segment.target: These rules are designed to enhance the reading experience of commonly used mathematical structures. The system analyzes the content according to the MathML structure and mathematical rules, so that the speech outputs and Braille outputs are more consistent with the mathematical meaning. For example, "x^2" will be read as "square of x" instead of "x super 2".

segment.source: Enable or disable this functionality by checking the "Analyze mathematical meaning of contents" checkbox in Settings > Reading. Uncheck this option to view the original MathML structure.
segment.target: Enable or disable this functionality by checking the "Analyze mathematical meaning of contents" checkbox in Settings > Reading. Uncheck this option to view the original MathML structure.

segment.source: This option also changes the given additional information of the mathematical meaning when navigating between math segments in Interactive Mode.
segment.target: This option also changes the given additional information of the mathematical meaning when navigating between math segments in Interactive Mode.

segment.source: Simplified Speech Outputs
segment.target: Simplified Speech Outputs

segment.source: When the system analyzes mathematical rules, it will read them out in a simplified way. If there is only one single item in the math content, it can omit the markups before and after while reading, so that it can be understood more efficiently. For example, "\(\frac{1}{2}\)" will be read as "1 over 2" instead of "fraction with numerator 1 and denominator 2 end fraction".
segment.target: When the system analyzes mathematical rules, it will read them out in a simplified way. If there is only one single item in the math content, it can omit the markups before and after while reading, so that it can be understood more efficiently. For example, "\(\frac{1}{2}\)" will be read as "1 over 2" instead of "fraction with numerator 1 and denominator 2 end fraction".

segment.source: Enable or disable a simplified rule from the list of checkboxes in Settings > Rules.
segment.target: Enable or disable a simplified rule from the list of checkboxes in Settings > Rules.

segment.source: Pauses Between Segments
segment.target: Pauses Between Segments

segment.source: Access8Math reads math content with a pause between items to make the math content easier to understand.
segment.target: Access8Math reads math content with a pause between items to make the math content easier to understand.

segment.source: To adjust the pause time between items, set a value from 1 to 100 in Settings > Reading. A smaller value means a shorter pause time and a larger value means a longer pause time.
segment.target: To adjust the pause time between items, set a value from 1 to 100 in Settings > Reading. A smaller value means a shorter pause time and a larger value means a longer pause time.

segment.source: Math Reader Settings
segment.target: Math Reader Settings

segment.source: Select the source of the math reader in Settings > Math Reader.
segment.target: Select the source of the math reader in Settings > Math Reader.

segment.source: Speech Source: Use Access8Math/MathCAT/Math Player for speech outputs.
segment.target: Speech Source: Use Access8Math/MathCAT/Math Player for speech outputs.

segment.source: Braille Source: Use Access8Math/MathCAT/Math Player for Braille outputs.
segment.target: Braille Source: Use Access8Math/MathCAT/Math Player for Braille outputs.

segment.source: Interaction Source: Use Access8Math/MathCAT/Math Player for Interactive Mode.
segment.target: Interaction Source: Use Access8Math/MathCAT/Math Player for Interactive Mode.

segment.source: Customize Math Symbol Speech Outputs and Braille Outputs
segment.target: Customize Math Symbol Speech Outputs and Braille Outputs

segment.source: In the "Localization" menu, it’s possible to edit the table of math symbols and the table of mathematical rules. For more details, please refer to the "Localization" section of this document.
segment.target: In the "Localization" menu, it’s possible to edit the table of math symbols and the table of mathematical rules. For more details, please refer to the "Localization" section of this document.

segment.source: Interaction Features
segment.target: Interaction Features

segment.source: How to Activate NVDA Interactive Mode?
segment.target: How to Activate NVDA Interactive Mode?

segment.source: For speech-oriented users, it is often preferable to listen to a math equation in smaller segments rather than hearing the whole equation at once. If currently in Browse mode, move the cursor over the math content and press the Space or Enter key.
segment.target: For speech-oriented users, it is often preferable to listen to a math equation in smaller segments rather than hearing the whole equation at once. If currently in Browse mode, move the cursor over the math content and press the Space or Enter key.

segment.source: If not in Browse mode:
segment.target: If not in Browse mode:

segment.source: Move the review cursor to the location of the math content. By default, the review cursor follows the system caret so the system cursor can be moved to the math content.
segment.target: Move the review cursor to the location of the math content. By default, the review cursor follows the system caret so the system cursor can be moved to the math content.

segment.source: Execute the following shortcut: NVDA + Alt + M to interact with the math content.
segment.target: Execute the following shortcut: NVDA + Alt + M to interact with the math content.

segment.source: Once in Interactive Mode, use commands such as the arrow keys to explore an equation. For example, use the left and right arrow to move within an equation, and use the down arrow to explore a segment of the equation.
segment.target: Once in Interactive Mode, use commands such as the arrow keys to explore an equation. For example, use the left and right arrow to move within an equation, and use the down arrow to explore a segment of the equation.

segment.source: When finished reading, simply press Esc to return to the document. For more information about reading and navigating in Math Content, see the next section.
segment.target: When finished reading, simply press Esc to return to the document. For more information about reading and navigating in Math Content, see the next section.

segment.source: Available Keyboard Controls in Access8Math Interactive Mode
segment.target: Available Keyboard Controls in Access8Math Interactive Mode

segment.source: Down arrow: Reduces the scope of the reading segment.
segment.target: Down arrow: Reduces the scope of the reading segment.

segment.source: Up arrow: Enlarges the scope of the reading segment.
segment.target: Up arrow: Enlarges the scope of the reading segment.

segment.source: Left arrow: Go to the previous math segment.
segment.target: Left arrow: Go to the previous math segment.

segment.source: Right arrow: Go to the next math segment.
segment.target: Right arrow: Go to the next math segment.

segment.source: Ctrl + C: Copy the MathML of the object.
segment.target: Ctrl + C: Copy the MathML of the object.

segment.source: Home key: Reads the entire math content.
segment.target: Home key: Reads the entire math content.

segment.source: Numeric Keypad 1-9: Use NVDA Review Mode to read the math content (see the Review Mode section of the NVDA User Guide).
segment.target: Numeric Keypad 1-9: Use NVDA Review Mode to read the math content (see the Review Mode section of the NVDA User Guide).

segment.source: Esc key: Quit Interactive Mode.
segment.target: Esc key: Quit Interactive Mode.

segment.source: Table navigation: In a math table, use Ctrl + Alt + arrow keys to move up or down a column, left or right a row. The navigation is the same as NVDA table navigation.
segment.target: Table navigation: In a math table, use Ctrl + Alt + arrow keys to move up or down a column, left or right a row. The navigation is the same as NVDA table navigation.

segment.source: Ctrl + Alt + Left arrow: Move to the left column.
segment.target: Ctrl + Alt + Left arrow: Move to the left column.

segment.source: Ctrl + Alt + Right arrow: Move to the right column.
segment.target: Ctrl + Alt + Right arrow: Move to the right column.

segment.source: Ctrl + Alt + Up arrow: Move to the previous row.
segment.target: Ctrl + Alt + Up arrow: Move to the previous row.

segment.source: Ctrl + Alt + Down arrow: Move to the next row.
segment.target: Ctrl + Alt + Down arrow: Move to the next row.

segment.source: Adjust Additional Information for Outputs in Interactive Mode
segment.target: Adjust Additional Information for Outputs in Interactive Mode

segment.source: Provide auto-generated additional information: In Interactive Mode, the system provides additional information about the number of items when meanings of sub-nodes are not fully defined in a math rule. This feature applies to situations where some MathML markups may have a variable number of sub-nodes, such as tables, matrices, or equations. The system provides additional information like "first column", "second item", and so on, while navigating. If not willing to hear the additional information, uncheck this setting.
segment.target: Provide auto-generated additional information: In Interactive Mode, the system provides additional information about the number of items when meanings of sub-nodes are not fully defined in a math rule. This feature applies to situations where some MathML markups may have a variable number of sub-nodes, such as tables, matrices, or equations. The system provides additional information like "first column", "second item", and so on, while navigating. If not willing to hear the additional information, uncheck this setting.

segment.source: Use an sound effect to indicate that no movement is possible: When checked, a beep sound appears when it’s not possible to move to a new item; when unchecked, the sound will be replaced by the text "no movement".
segment.target: Use an sound effect to indicate that no movement is possible: When checked, a beep sound appears when it’s not possible to move to a new item; when unchecked, the sound will be replaced by the text "no movement".

segment.source: Writing Features
segment.target: Writing Features

segment.source: Access8Math Editor
segment.target: Access8Math Editor

segment.source: Access8Math editor allows users to write Markdown documents and add resources (such as images, links, etc.) to the editor’s workspace for referencing them in a document.
segment.target: Access8Math editor allows users to write Markdown documents and add resources (such as images, links, etc.) to the editor’s workspace for referencing them in a document.

segment.source: When exporting documents, Access8Math editor converts Markdown files into HTML files which displays both the text and the math content. The resources in the document will be archived into the output zip file. This allows the exported HTML file to display various types of contents (such as text, math, images, videos, and audios).
segment.target: When exporting documents, Access8Math editor converts Markdown files into HTML files which displays both the text and the math content. The resources in the document will be archived into the output zip file. This allows the exported HTML file to display various types of contents (such as text, math, images, videos, and audios).

segment.source: For more information on how to use the import and export features, please refer to the "Import and Export'' section of this document.
segment.target: For more information on how to use the import and export features, please refer to the "Import and Export'' section of this document.

segment.source: Separators
segment.target: Separators

segment.source: When writing, special characters are used to separate text content from math content. In other words, the content inside the separators is math content written in a specific math markup, while the content outside is general text content.
segment.target: When writing, special characters are used to separate text content from math content. In other words, the content inside the separators is math content written in a specific math markup, while the content outside is general text content.

segment.source: Category | Staring Separator | Ending Separator
segment.target: Category | Staring Separator | Ending Separator

segment.source: LaTeX (Parentheses) | \( | \)
segment.target: LaTeX (Parentheses) | \( | \)

segment.source: LaTeX (Dollar sign) | $ | $
segment.target: LaTeX (Dollar sign) | $ | $

segment.source: Nemeth (UEB) | _% | _:
segment.target: Nemeth (UEB) | _% | _:

segment.source: Nemeth (at) | @ | @
segment.target: Nemeth (at) | @ | @

segment.source: Note: It’s possible to change the separators used in LaTeX/Nemeth in the Settings > Document.
segment.target: Note: It’s possible to change the separators used in LaTeX/Nemeth in the Settings > Document.

segment.source: Mixed Content Examples
segment.target: Mixed Content Examples

segment.source: LaTeX (Parentheses): The solution to the quadratic equation \(ax^2+bx+c=0\) is \(x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}\).
segment.target: LaTeX (Parentheses): The solution to the quadratic equation \(ax^2+bx+c=0\) is \(x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}\).

segment.source: LaTeX (Dollar sign): The solution to the quadratic equation $ax^2+bx+c=0$ is $x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}$.
segment.target: LaTeX (Dollar sign): The solution to the quadratic equation $ax^2+bx+c=0$ is $x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}$.

segment.source: Nemeth(UEB): The solution to the quadratic equation _%⠁⠭⠘⠆⠐⠬⠃⠭⠬⠉⠀⠨⠅⠀⠴_: is _%⠭⠀⠨⠅⠀⠹⠤⠃⠬⠤⠜⠃⠘⠆⠐⠤⠲⠁⠉⠻⠌⠆⠁⠼_:.
segment.target: Nemeth(UEB): The solution to the quadratic equation _%⠁⠭⠘⠆⠐⠬⠃⠭⠬⠉⠀⠨⠅⠀⠴_: is _%⠭⠀⠨⠅⠀⠹⠤⠃⠬⠤⠜⠃⠘⠆⠐⠤⠲⠁⠉⠻⠌⠆⠁⠼_:.

segment.source: Nemeth(at): The solution to the quadratic equation @⠁⠭⠘⠆⠐⠬⠃⠭⠬⠉⠀⠨⠅⠀⠴@ is @⠭⠀⠨⠅⠀⠹⠤⠃⠬⠤⠜⠃⠘⠆⠐⠤⠲⠁⠉⠻⠌⠆⠁⠼@.
segment.target: Nemeth(at): The solution to the quadratic equation @⠁⠭⠘⠆⠐⠬⠃⠭⠬⠉⠀⠨⠅⠀⠴@ is @⠭⠀⠨⠅⠀⠹⠤⠃⠬⠤⠜⠃⠘⠆⠐⠤⠲⠁⠉⠻⠌⠆⠁⠼@.

segment.source: MathML: The solution to the quadratic equation <math display="inline"><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> is <math display="inline"><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>±</mi><msqrt><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>.
segment.target: MathML: The solution to the quadratic equation <math display="inline"><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> is <math display="inline"><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>±</mi><msqrt><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>.

segment.source: Command Gestures (Toggle: NVDA + Alt + C)
segment.target: Command Gestures (Toggle: NVDA + Alt + C)

segment.source: Alt + M: Display the markup command menu. In the window, select LaTeX/Nemeth, and press Enter. It will add the LaTeX/Nemeth markups before and after the currently selected text (or at the current editing cursor if no text is selected), and automatically move the editing cursor into the markups.
segment.target: Alt + M: Display the markup command menu. In the window, select LaTeX/Nemeth, and press Enter. It will add the LaTeX/Nemeth markups before and after the currently selected text (or at the current editing cursor if no text is selected), and automatically move the editing cursor into the markups.

segment.source: Alt + L: Display the LaTeX command menu (virtual menu). In the window, select a LaTeX command item, and press Enter. The corresponding LaTeX syntax will be added to the current editing cursor, and the editing cursor will be moved to the appropriate input point automatically. If the editing cursor is not in the LaTeX area, the starting and ending separators will be added automatically.
segment.target: Alt + L: Display the LaTeX command menu (virtual menu). In the window, select a LaTeX command item, and press Enter. The corresponding LaTeX syntax will be added to the current editing cursor, and the editing cursor will be moved to the appropriate input point automatically. If the editing cursor is not in the LaTeX area, the starting and ending separators will be added automatically.

segment.source: LaTeX Command Menu
segment.target: LaTeX Command Menu

segment.source: In this command menu, use the up and down arrow to select items in the list, and use the right and left arrow to enter or quit a sub-menu. The LaTeX command menu contains two levels: categories and LaTeX markups. For example, use the up and down arrow to select a category in the category list, then use the right arrow to enter the LaTeX markup sub-menu to select the LaTeX markup to be inserted.
segment.target: In this command menu, use the up and down arrow to select items in the list, and use the right and left arrow to enter or quit a sub-menu. The LaTeX command menu contains two levels: categories and LaTeX markups. For example, use the up and down arrow to select a category in the category list, then use the right arrow to enter the LaTeX markup sub-menu to select the LaTeX markup to be inserted.

segment.source: Select any LaTeX command item and press A ~ Z or F1 ~ F12 to set the shortcut gesture.
segment.target: Select any LaTeX command item and press A ~ Z or F1 ~ F12 to set the shortcut gesture.

segment.source: Select any LaTeX command item and press Delete/Backspace to remove the set shortcut gesture.
segment.target: Select any LaTeX command item and press Delete/Backspace to remove the set shortcut gesture.

segment.source: Select any LaTeX command item and press Enter to add the corresponding LaTeX syntax to the current editing cursor.
segment.target: Select any LaTeX command item and press Enter to add the corresponding LaTeX syntax to the current editing cursor.

segment.source: Alt + I: Interact with the math block when the editing cursor is over it.
segment.target: Alt + I: Interact with the math block when the editing cursor is over it.

segment.source: Alt + H: Show the view command menu (virtual menu) for preview or export. Please refer to the “Import and Export” section for more details.
segment.target: Alt + H: Show the view command menu (virtual menu) for preview or export. Please refer to the “Import and Export” section for more details.

segment.source: Note: Enable or disable command gestures at startup in Settings > Writing. Press NVDA + Alt + C in the editing area to enable or disable the command gesture. The shortcut can be changed in the NVDA input gestures.
segment.target: Note: Enable or disable command gestures at startup in Settings > Writing. Press NVDA + Alt + C in the editing area to enable or disable the command gesture. The shortcut can be changed in the NVDA input gestures.

segment.source: Shortcut Gestures (Toggle: NVDA + Alt + S)
segment.target: Shortcut Gestures (Toggle: NVDA + Alt + S)

segment.source: When the editing cursor is in the LaTeX block, press A ~ Z or F1 ~ F12 to quickly insert the bound LaTeX, and press Shift + Alphabets, Shift + F1 ~ F12 to read out the bound LaTeX of the shortcut gesture (it’s necessary to set up the shortcut gesture in the LaTeX Command Menu first).
segment.target: When the editing cursor is in the LaTeX block, press A ~ Z or F1 ~ F12 to quickly insert the bound LaTeX, and press Shift + Alphabets, Shift + F1 ~ F12 to read out the bound LaTeX of the shortcut gesture (it’s necessary to set up the shortcut gesture in the LaTeX Command Menu first).

segment.source: Note: Enable or disable shortcut gestures at startup in Settings > Writing. Press NVDA + Alt + S in the editor to enable or disable shortcut gestures. The shortcut can be changed in the NVDA input gestures.
segment.target: Note: Enable or disable shortcut gestures at startup in Settings > Writing. Press NVDA + Alt + S in the editor to enable or disable shortcut gestures. The shortcut can be changed in the NVDA input gestures.

segment.source: Greek Alphabets Gestures (Toggle: NVDA + Alt + G)
segment.target: Greek Alphabets Gestures (Toggle: NVDA + Alt + G)

segment.source: When the editing cursor is in the LaTeX block, press a letter key to quickly insert the LaTeX markup of the corresponding Greek letter. See the "Appendix" of this document for Alphabet to Greek Alphabet Table.
segment.target: When the editing cursor is in the LaTeX block, press a letter key to quickly insert the LaTeX markup of the corresponding Greek letter. See the "Appendix" of this document for Alphabet to Greek Alphabet Table.

segment.source: Editing and Navigating Between Blocks
segment.target: Editing and Navigating Between Blocks

segment.source: In Access8Math editor, content separated by separators is treated as different blocks, such as text blocks and math content blocks. The editing cursor can be quickly moved between different blocks using the block navigation.
segment.target: In Access8Math editor, content separated by separators is treated as different blocks, such as text blocks and math content blocks. The editing cursor can be quickly moved between different blocks using the block navigation.

segment.source: Take the content "The solution of the quadratic equation \(ax^2+bx+c=0\) is \(x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}\)" as an example, there are two main math content blocks and two text blocks, which can be labeled as Block A, Block B, Block C and Block D:
segment.target: Take the content "The solution of the quadratic equation \(ax^2+bx+c=0\) is \(x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}\)" as an example, there are two main math content blocks and two text blocks, which can be labeled as Block A, Block B, Block C and Block D:

segment.source: Block A: The six words "The solution of the quadratic equation" is one text block.
segment.target: Block A: The six words "The solution of the quadratic equation" is one text block.

segment.source: Block B: The math block \(ax^2+bx+c=0\) starts with a starting separator and ends with the ending separator after 0.
segment.target: Block B: The math block \(ax^2+bx+c=0\) starts with a starting separator and ends with the ending separator after 0.

segment.source: Block C: The word "is" is another text block.
segment.target: Block C: The word "is" is another text block.

segment.source: Block D: The second math block \(x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}\) starts with the starting separator and ends with the closing separator after the whole expression.
segment.target: Block D: The second math block \(x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}\) starts with the starting separator and ends with the closing separator after the whole expression.

segment.source: Block Navigation Gestures (Toggle: NVDA + Alt + N)
segment.target: Block Navigation Gestures (Toggle: NVDA + Alt + N)

segment.source: Alt + Left arrow: Move to the beginning of the previous block.
segment.target: Alt + Left arrow: Move to the beginning of the previous block.

segment.source: Alt + Down arrow: Read out the content of the current block without moving.
segment.target: Alt + Down arrow: Read out the content of the current block without moving.

segment.source: Alt + Right arrow: Move to the beginning of the next block.
segment.target: Alt + Right arrow: Move to the beginning of the next block.

segment.source: Alt + Home: Move to the beginning of the current block.
segment.target: Alt + Home: Move to the beginning of the current block.

segment.source: Alt + End: Move to the end of the current block.
segment.target: Alt + End: Move to the end of the current block.

segment.source: Alt + Shift + Left arrow: Move to the previous block and select it.
segment.target: Alt + Shift + Left arrow: Move to the previous block and select it.

segment.source: Alt + Shift + Down arrow: Select the content of the current data block without moving.
segment.target: Alt + Shift + Down arrow: Select the content of the current data block without moving.

segment.source: Alt + Shift + Right arrow: Move to the next block and select it.
segment.target: Alt + Shift + Right arrow: Move to the next block and select it.

segment.source: Note: Enable or disable block navigation gestures at startup in Settings > Writing. Press NVDA + Alt + N in the editor to enable or disable block navigation gestures. The shortcut can be changed in the NVDA input gestures.
segment.target: Note: Enable or disable block navigation gestures at startup in Settings > Writing. Press NVDA + Alt + N in the editor to enable or disable block navigation gestures. The shortcut can be changed in the NVDA input gestures.

segment.source: Block Browse Mode (Toggle: NVDA + Space)
segment.target: Block Browse Mode (Toggle: NVDA + Space)

segment.source: When using the Block Browsing mode, the system will output the mathematical meaning of the content instead of the original math markup of the current block. For example, “\(\frac{1}{2}\) as a decimal is 0.5” will output as "1 over 2 as a decimal is 0.5" instead of “\(\frac{1}{2}\) as a decimal is 0.5”.
segment.target: When using the Block Browsing mode, the system will output the mathematical meaning of the content instead of the original math markup of the current block. For example, “\(\frac{1}{2}\) as a decimal is 0.5” will output as "1 over 2 as a decimal is 0.5" instead of “\(\frac{1}{2}\) as a decimal is 0.5”.

segment.source: Use the following gestures to move the editing cursor and enter the Interactive Mode:
segment.target: Use the following gestures to move the editing cursor and enter the Interactive Mode:

segment.source: Left arrow: Move to the beginning of the previous block and read it.
segment.target: Left arrow: Move to the beginning of the previous block and read it.

segment.source: Right arrow: Move to the beginning of the next block and read it.
segment.target: Right arrow: Move to the beginning of the next block and read it.

segment.source: Up arrow: Move to the previous line and read all the blocks in that line.
segment.target: Up arrow: Move to the previous line and read all the blocks in that line.

segment.source: Down arrow: Move to the next line and read all the blocks in that line.
segment.target: Down arrow: Move to the next line and read all the blocks in that line.

segment.source: Page Up: Move up ten lines and read all the blocks in this area.
segment.target: Page Up: Move up ten lines and read all the blocks in this area.

segment.source: Page Down: Move down ten lines and read all the blocks in this area.
segment.target: Page Down: Move down ten lines and read all the blocks in this area.

segment.source: Home: Move to the first block of the line where the editing cursor is located.
segment.target: Home: Move to the first block of the line where the editing cursor is located.

segment.source: End: Move to the last block of the line where the editing cursor is located.
segment.target: End: Move to the last block of the line where the editing cursor is located.

segment.source: Press Shift with the above keys to select the text.
segment.target: Press Shift with the above keys to select the text.

segment.source: Space/Enter: Press Space/Enter when the editing cursor is on a math block to enter the Interactive Mode.
segment.target: Space/Enter: Press Space/Enter when the editing cursor is on a math block to enter the Interactive Mode.

segment.source: If pressing the following keys only, the editing cursor will jump to the next block of that type. If pressing Shift + the key at the same time, the editing cursor will jump to the previous block of that type:
segment.target: If pressing the following keys only, the editing cursor will jump to the next block of that type. If pressing Shift + the key at the same time, the editing cursor will jump to the previous block of that type:

segment.source: L: Move to the next LaTeX block and read it.
segment.target: L: Move to the next LaTeX block and read it.

segment.source: N: Move to the next Nemeth block and read it.
segment.target: N: Move to the next Nemeth block and read it.

segment.source: M: Move to the next MathML block and read it.
segment.target: M: Move to the next MathML block and read it.

segment.source: T: Move to the next text block and read it.
segment.target: T: Move to the next text block and read it.

segment.source: Tab: Move to the next interactive block (Math block) and read it.
segment.target: Tab: Move to the next interactive block (Math block) and read it.

segment.source: Use the following gestures to edit the document:
segment.target: Use the following gestures to edit the document:

segment.source: Ctrl + X: Cut the contents of the current editing block.
segment.target: Ctrl + X: Cut the contents of the current editing block.

segment.source: Ctrl + C: Copy the content of the current editing block.
segment.target: Ctrl + C: Copy the content of the current editing block.

segment.source: Ctrl + V: Paste the content behind the current editing block.
segment.target: Ctrl + V: Paste the content behind the current editing block.

segment.source: Delete/Backspace: Delete the content of the current block.
segment.target: Delete/Backspace: Delete the content of the current block.

segment.source: Import and Export
segment.target: Import and Export

segment.source: Export a Document
segment.target: Export a Document

segment.source: For the “preview” feature in the Access8Math editor's View menu, it allows users to convert the Markdown document to an HTML document for previewing.
segment.target: For the “preview” feature in the Access8Math editor's View menu, it allows users to convert the Markdown document to an HTML document for previewing.

segment.source: The math content in the Markdown document will be converted to MathML, which allows different users to view it easily (visually or through speech or Braille). As for resources (such as images, videos or audios), they will be converted into appropriate HTML elements and reference the correct resource files. Therefore, the output HTML document can display various types of contents.
segment.target: The math content in the Markdown document will be converted to MathML, which allows different users to view it easily (visually or through speech or Braille). As for resources (such as images, videos or audios), they will be converted into appropriate HTML elements and reference the correct resource files. Therefore, the output HTML document can display various types of contents.

segment.source: For the “export” feature in the Access8Math editor's View menu, it allows users to save and share the document. Two types of documents will be exported:
segment.target: For the “export” feature in the Access8Math editor's View menu, it allows users to save and share the document. Two types of documents will be exported:

segment.source: Access8Math Document file (*.a8m): Access8Math Document file can be imported into the editor again for modification.
segment.target: Access8Math Document file (*.a8m): Access8Math Document file can be imported into the editor again for modification.

segment.source: Archive file (*.zip): The HTML file in the archive file is the same as the HTML file converted for the preview feature. All users can read this HTML document without install Access8Math.
segment.target: Archive file (*.zip): The HTML file in the archive file is the same as the HTML file converted for the preview feature. All users can read this HTML document without install Access8Math.

segment.source: Import a Document
segment.target: Import a Document

segment.source: There are two ways to open an Access8Math Document:
segment.target: There are two ways to open an Access8Math Document:

segment.source: File Explorer: In the File Explorer, select an Access8Math Document and press NVDA + application key or NVDA + Shift + F10 to open a virtual menu. Select “view” or “edit" option to open the document.
segment.target: File Explorer: In the File Explorer, select an Access8Math Document and press NVDA + application key or NVDA + Shift + F10 to open a virtual menu. Select “view” or “edit" option to open the document.

segment.source: Access8Math Editor: Open any .a8m file by selecting the "Open” option in the “File” menu in the editor.
segment.target: Access8Math Editor: Open any .a8m file by selecting the "Open” option in the “File” menu in the editor.

segment.source: Note: Configure whether or not the math objects in the exported HTML are independant blocks with the “HTML Math Display'' setting in Settings > File. This setting will affect whether the math objects are read independently or mixed with normal text when navigating with arrow keys to read the whole line in the Browse Mode.
segment.target: Note: Configure whether or not the math objects in the exported HTML are independant blocks with the “HTML Math Display'' setting in Settings > File. This setting will affect whether the math objects are read independently or mixed with normal text when navigating with arrow keys to read the whole line in the Browse Mode.

segment.source: Virtual Menus
segment.target: Virtual Menus

segment.source: Virtual menus will be presented only as speech and braille outputs. There is no actual visual menu. Select an item in the list by using the up/down arrow. If the menu item has a sub-menu, use the right key to enter the sub-menu; use the left key to exit the sub-menu.
segment.target: Virtual menus will be presented only as speech and braille outputs. There is no actual visual menu. Select an item in the list by using the up/down arrow. If the menu item has a sub-menu, use the right key to enter the sub-menu; use the left key to exit the sub-menu.

segment.source: Localisation
segment.target: Localisation

segment.source: Adding a New Language
segment.target: Adding a New Language

segment.source: By clicking this option in the “Localisation” menu, languages that are not originally supported by the system can be added. Once added, the newly added language will appear in the "Settings" > "Reading" > "Language" menu. However, the added language is only a copy of the English language template. The speech and Braille outputs need to be defined through "Symbol Dictionary" and "Math Rules" to achieve customized localization.
segment.target: By clicking this option in the “Localisation” menu, languages that are not originally supported by the system can be added. Once added, the newly added language will appear in the "Settings" > "Reading" > "Language" menu. However, the added language is only a copy of the English language template. The speech and Braille outputs need to be defined through "Symbol Dictionary" and "Math Rules" to achieve customized localization.

segment.source: Customizing Speech and Braille Outputs for Math Symbols
segment.target: Customizing Speech and Braille Outputs for Math Symbols

segment.source: In the "Tools" > "Access8Math" > "Localization" menu, speech and Braille outputs can be customized. Both speech and Braille outputs are divided into two parts: "Symbol Dictionary" and "Math Rules."
segment.target: In the "Tools" > "Access8Math" > "Localization" menu, speech and Braille outputs can be customized. Both speech and Braille outputs are divided into two parts: "Symbol Dictionary" and "Math Rules."

segment.source: Symbol Speech Dictionary: Customize how different math symbols are read.
segment.target: Symbol Speech Dictionary: Customize how different math symbols are read.

segment.source: Math Rules Speech Output: Customize how different math rules are read.
segment.target: Math Rules Speech Output: Customize how different math rules are read.

segment.source: Symbol Braille Dictionary: Customize how different math symbols are displayed in Braille outputs.
segment.target: Symbol Braille Dictionary: Customize how different math symbols are displayed in Braille outputs.

segment.source: Math Rules Braille Output: Customize how different math rules are displayed in Braille outputs.
segment.target: Math Rules Braille Output: Customize how different math rules are displayed in Braille outputs.

segment.source: Editing Symbol Dictionary
segment.target: Editing Symbol Dictionary

segment.source: Access8Math maps specific symbols to corresponding text/ braille outputs through a dictionary file to solve issues where rare symbols cannot be read by speech synthesizers or where symbols have different meanings between mathematical contexts and general text.
segment.target: Access8Math maps specific symbols to corresponding text/ braille outputs through a dictionary file to solve issues where rare symbols cannot be read by speech synthesizers or where symbols have different meanings between mathematical contexts and general text.

segment.source: For example, "!" means "factorial" in mathematical content, while in general text it represents emotion. By editing the dictionary file, symbols can be mapped to new alternative texts or Braille outputs to update incorrect outputs..
segment.target: For example, "!" means "factorial" in mathematical content, while in general text it represents emotion. By editing the dictionary file, symbols can be mapped to new alternative texts or Braille outputs to update incorrect outputs..

segment.source: Add: Introduce a new symbol entry to the dictionary. After selecting the add button, enter the desired symbol in the dialog box and confirm. Then, the added symbol will appear in the entry list in the Symbol Dictionary dialog.
segment.target: Add: Introduce a new symbol entry to the dictionary. After selecting the add button, enter the desired symbol in the dialog box and confirm. Then, the added symbol will appear in the entry list in the Symbol Dictionary dialog.

segment.source: Modify: Choose a symbol and edit its alternative text. The system will then read out and display Braille outputs based on the alternative text.
segment.target: Modify: Choose a symbol and edit its alternative text. The system will then read out and display Braille outputs based on the alternative text.

segment.source: Remove: Select a symbol and press the remove button to eliminate the chosen entry.
segment.target: Remove: Select a symbol and press the remove button to eliminate the chosen entry.

segment.source: Restore Default Values: Reset the dictionary to the default entries defined by the system.
segment.target: Restore Default Values: Reset the dictionary to the default entries defined by the system.

segment.source: Import: Bring in a symbol dictionary file, which can load exported symbol dictionary files.
segment.target: Import: Bring in a symbol dictionary file, which can load exported symbol dictionary files.

segment.source: Export: Save the symbol dictionary file to a specified path for sharing or saving.
segment.target: Export: Save the symbol dictionary file to a specified path for sharing or saving.

segment.source: Editing Math Rules
segment.target: Editing Math Rules

segment.source: Access8Math establishes corresponding mathematical rules for the MathML structure of commonly used math content. When encountering MathML structures that match the rules, the system will read out and display them according to the content defined in the mathematical rules. The speech outputs and Braille outputs can be customized according to the habits of different regions.
segment.target: Access8Math establishes corresponding mathematical rules for the MathML structure of commonly used math content. When encountering MathML structures that match the rules, the system will read out and display them according to the content defined in the mathematical rules. The speech outputs and Braille outputs can be customized according to the habits of different regions.

segment.source: Edit: In the Math Rules dialog, there is a list of mathematical rules. Select any rule and click the "Edit" button to enter the editing dialog. The editable fields of the rule can be divided into two parts, "Serialization Order" and "Mathematical Meaning of Specific Nodes."
segment.target: Edit: In the Math Rules dialog, there is a list of mathematical rules. Select any rule and click the "Edit" button to enter the editing dialog. The editable fields of the rule can be divided into two parts, "Serialization Order" and "Mathematical Meaning of Specific Nodes."

segment.source: Serialization Order: In Access8Math, each math rule is divided into several segments, and these segments are output in a specific order. In this section, the output order of specific segments, as well as the text at the beginning, between segments, and at the end can be adjusted. For example, in the fraction rule "mfrac", this rule is divided into five segments. Orders 0, 2, and 4 represent the starting text, the separating text between segments 1 and 3, and the ending text. Each text can be adjusted according to preference. Orders 1 and 3 allow adjustments to the output order of specific segments by the drop-down menu.
segment.target: Serialization Order: In Access8Math, each math rule is divided into several segments, and these segments are output in a specific order. In this section, the output order of specific segments, as well as the text at the beginning, between segments, and at the end can be adjusted. For example, in the fraction rule "mfrac", this rule is divided into five segments. Orders 0, 2, and 4 represent the starting text, the separating text between segments 1 and 3, and the ending text. Each text can be adjusted according to preference. Orders 1 and 3 allow adjustments to the output order of specific segments by the drop-down menu.

segment.source: Mathematical Meaning of Specific Nodes: The mathematical meaning of specific segments of the math rule can be adjusted in this section. Taking the fraction rule "mfrac" as an example, this rule contains two specific segments: the numerator and the denominator. You can change the meaning of each specific segment according to the math rule.
segment.target: Mathematical Meaning of Specific Nodes: The mathematical meaning of specific segments of the math rule can be adjusted in this section. Taking the fraction rule "mfrac" as an example, this rule contains two specific segments: the numerator and the denominator. You can change the meaning of each specific segment according to the math rule.

segment.source: Example: Verify if a rule is read in the correct way after editing. Clicking the “Example” button will bring up default mathematical content that matches the corresponding mathematical rule. Users can interact with the content to see whether a rule is read in the correct way.
segment.target: Example: Verify if a rule is read in the correct way after editing. Clicking the “Example” button will bring up default mathematical content that matches the corresponding mathematical rule. Users can interact with the content to see whether a rule is read in the correct way.

segment.source: Restore Default Values: Reset the list of mathematical rules to the initial default values.
segment.target: Restore Default Values: Reset the list of mathematical rules to the initial default values.

segment.source: Import: Import a mathematical rules file, which can be used to load exported mathematical rules files.
segment.target: Import: Import a mathematical rules file, which can be used to load exported mathematical rules files.

segment.source: Export: Save the mathematical rules file to the specified path for sharing or saving.
segment.target: Export: Save the mathematical rules file to the specified path for sharing or saving.

segment.source: If you are interested in localizing symbol dictionaries and mathematical rules, edit them through these two windows, and use the export function to obtain edited files. Then, you can provide these files to the development team through Access8Math GitHub Pull requests or Email (tsengwoody.tw@gmail.com). We would be happy to include your translation in Access8Math.
segment.target: If you are interested in localizing symbol dictionaries and mathematical rules, edit them through these two windows, and use the export function to obtain edited files. Then, you can provide these files to the development team through Access8Math GitHub Pull requests or Email (tsengwoody.tw@gmail.com). We would be happy to include your translation in Access8Math.
